title: A hinged rod

children.value:
A uniform rod of length 
$\vari{2a}$
 runs from A to B and has mass 
$\vari{km}$
. The rod is hinged at both ends with the point A fixed. The other end is freely hinged to another rod of length 
$\vari{2a}$
 and mass 
$\vari{m}$
. Both rods are in equilibrium with the first rod horizontal and the second is inclined at some angle 
$\vari{\theta }$
 to the vertical with its unhinged end in contact with the rough floor. The coefficient of friction between the rod and the floor is 
$\vari{\mu }$
. See Figure 
1
.
